anyone?: what is the topology?
are both subnets on the same wire or are they separated by a router?
same wire, separated by Vyatta server
the vyatta server is multi-homed?
yes if i'm on vyatta i can access both subnets
is the server your default route for either side?
no
so you need to setup a  network route.       something like:    route add -net  192.168.X.X/24    gw  vyatta
Both sides need routes setup .    they packets need to know how to get there and how to get back.    Or you can setup the routes on your default routers
ok, i'll try that
how many machines need to talk accross the router?
mine only
bear in mind also,   there is the concept of  forwarding.     If the vyatta is not setup to forward packets accross the interfaces, then it will be a wall
Vyatta can talk to other subnets nicely
you said mine.    you did not say how many boxes on the other side need to talk back?

luck
it works perfectly
